abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Industrial Pollution Control
            Project. The outcome of the project is rated as satisfactory
            because, despite implementation delays, the most significant
            components of the loan (in terms of value and priority
            assigned in the SAR) were mostly achieved. The main findings
            of this project are: 1) The project would have benefited
            from better pipeline preparation by appraisal; 2) The
            experience of low demand from the previous loan was not
            fully internalized in project design; 3) Project risks were
            not fully recognized; 4) The TA component for CETESB was
            successful although its full potential was not achieved. The
            project offers the following lessons: a) Define specific
            environmental quality objectives, link enforcement actions
            and performance indicators more closely; b) Use credit more
            selectively; c) Recognize coverage limitations of credit;
            and d) Recognize other forms of assistance.
